meanings.definition: To dance in a wild or uncontrolled manner.
meanings.sent1: She skanked joyfully at the party, moving to the music with abandon.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends skanked together at the concert, enjoying the energetic beat.
meanings.sent3: The cat skanked around the living room, chasing its tail in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The wind skanked through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle in a wild rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The children skanked in the playground, their laughter echoing in the air.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: He skanked some cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief skanked the jewels from the museum under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon skanked the picnic basket, sneaking away with the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The shadow skanked across the room, taking the precious sunlight with it.
meanings.sent5: The magician skanked the watch from the audience member's pocket without them noticing.

meanings.sent1: She skanked her brother into believing he had won the game, but it was a trick.
meanings.sent2: The con artist skanked the old man out of his life savings with a clever scheme.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf skanked the travelers with illusions along their journey.
meanings.sent4: The mirage skanked the weary travelers, leading them further into the desert.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox skanked the rabbit by pretending to be injured, luring it into a trap.
